byline.original: By NICHOLAS CASEY and MARÍA EUGENIA DÍAZ

lead_paragraph: Though the two cases were the first confirmed in the country since the infection spread there, officials said they did not expect the birth defects to reach the same scale as in Brazil.

headline.print_headline: Colombia Finds 2 Cases of Defects Linked to Zika
headline.main: Colombia Reports First Cases of Microcephaly Linked to Zika Virus

snippet: Though the two cases were the first confirmed in the country since the infection spread there, officials said they did not expect the birth defects to reach the same scale as in Brazil.
abstract: Colombian health officials confirm country's first cases of microcephaly linked to Zika virus since infection spread in country; hold scale will not grow to that seen in Brazil; announcement comes day after Centers for Disease Control and Prevention formally links Zika to severe birth defects.
